elements.description:
`overlay-element`
A helper-element, that creates an overlay using `iron-overlay-behavior` of Polymer.

methods.name: _attachDom
methods.description: attach dom with `delegatesFocus: true` so that the element is also focussed while its's children are too, and to autofocus to first tabable

elements.name: OverlayElement

mixins.description: mixin to extend an element, to be compatible with iron-form

mixins.description: Mixin to extend an element that includes a native input to be wrapped to enable content-based resizing and validation. The pattern is using `input-shared-style` to unify the style between different inputs and should resize according to its properties and input.

properties.name: name
properties.description: name of the input

properties.name: title
properties.description: description for the element and can be used as a hint for invalid values

properties.name: propertyForValue
properties.description: defines the property that should be used for the value

properties.name: value
properties.description: value of the input

properties.name: default
properties.description: default value of the value, when it does not validate

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: disables the input

properties.name: invalid
properties.description: required attribute

properties.name: required
properties.description: required attribute

properties.name: valueIsSet
properties.description: is true when the value is set

properties.name: _isSet
properties.description: defines whether the value is set

properties.name: _validate
properties.description: validates the value (when required)

properties.name: type
properties.description: the type of the native input

properties.name: input
properties.description: the immediate input string

properties.name: validationMessage
properties.description: message to set on the input to show if the input does not validate

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: the placeholder string

properties.name: minlength
properties.description: the minlength of the input

properties.name: autoResize
properties.description: if true, the width will change when typing

properties.name: _minlengthString
properties.description: string that is used to compute the minimal width of the input

methods.name: _attachDom
methods.description: attach dom with `delegatesFocus: true` so that the element is also focussed while its's children are too, and to autofocus to first tabable

return.desc: true, if the value is set

params.name: isSet
params.description: The function that defines if the value is set

params.name: required
params.description: if true, the value is required

return.desc: true, if the value is valid

methods.name: _computeInvalid
methods.description: defines whether the value is set

methods.name: _computeValueIsSet
methods.description: defines whether the value is set

methods.name: validate
methods.description: validates the input for iron-form

methods.name: reset
methods.description: reset the value

methods.name: _confirmInput
methods.description: update manually the value with the native input

methods.name: _updateInput
methods.description: update manually the native input with the given value

methods.name: _computeMinlengthString
methods.description: compute the minimal string the input is sized for

methods.name: resize
methods.description: called automatically when static `_minlengthString` or visibilityState changes, but can be called manually to resize the minwidth of the input, when the input is for example initially hidden

methods.name: focus
methods.description: focus the input element

methods.name: blur
methods.description: removes focus from input

methods.name: select
methods.description: selects the input text in the element, and focuses it so the user can subsequently replace the whole entry

methods.name: click
methods.description: simulates a click on the element

methods.name: setCustomValidity
methods.description: sets on the native input a validity message

methods.name: reportValidity
methods.description: reports the validity state of the native input

mixins.description: mixin to extend an element with a test for an expected input type and implement a polyfill, when wanted or needed

properties.name: name
properties.description: name of the input

properties.name: title
properties.description: description for the element and can be used as a hint for invalid values

properties.name: propertyForValue
properties.description: defines the property that should be used for the value

properties.name: value
properties.description: value of the input

properties.name: default
properties.description: default value of the value, when it does not validate

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: disables the input

properties.name: invalid
properties.description: required attribute

properties.name: required
properties.description: required attribute

properties.name: valueIsSet
properties.description: is true when the value is set

properties.name: _isSet
properties.description: defines whether the value is set

properties.name: _validate
properties.description: validates the value (when required)

properties.name: native
properties.description: Set to `true` to use the native input, if it available

properties.name: nativeOnMobile
properties.description: Set to `true` to use the native input automatically on mobile devices, if it available

properties.name: mobileUserAgentTestString
properties.description: When `nativeOnMobile` is set to `true` this string is used to test the userAgent for a mobile device

properties.name: opened
properties.description: if `true` the picker is opened

properties.name: horizontalAlign
properties.description:
The orientation against which to align the element horizontally
relative to the related input element. Possible values are "left", "right", "center", "auto". (comparable to `iron-fit-behavior` and its `no-overlap`-attribute)

properties.name: verticalAlign
properties.description:
The orientation against which to align the element vertically
relative to the related input element. Possible values are "top", "bottom", "middle", "auto". (comparable to `iron-fit-behavior` and its `no-overlap`-attribute)

properties.name: autoConfirm
properties.description: Set to `true` to make the input auto-confirming

properties.name: noCancelOnEscKey
properties.description: Set to `true` to disable canceling the overlay with the ESC key.

properties.name: noCancelOnOutsideClick
properties.description: Set to `true` to disable canceling the dropdown by clicking outside the picker.

properties.name: noCloseOnPickerOpened
properties.description: Set to `true` to disable closing the dropdown when opening another picker.

properties.name: noTip
properties.description: Set to `true` to disable the tip of the picker

properties.name: confirmedValue
properties.description: The confirmed value. When `auto-confirm` is not set, the value will only change, when you confirm.

methods.name: _addEventListenerToNode
methods.description: Add the event listener to the node if it is a gestures event.

params.name: node
params.description: Node to add event listener to

methods.name: _removeEventListenerFromNode
methods.description: Remove the event listener to the node if it is a gestures event.

params.name: node
params.description: Node to remove event listener from

methods.name: _attachDom
methods.description: attach dom with `delegatesFocus: true` so that the element is also focussed while its's children are too, and to autofocus to first tabable

return.desc: true, if the value is set

params.name: isSet
params.description: The function that defines if the value is set

params.name: required
params.description: if true, the value is required

return.desc: true, if the value is valid

methods.name: _computeInvalid
methods.description: defines whether the value is set

methods.name: _computeValueIsSet
methods.description: defines whether the value is set

methods.name: reset
methods.description: reset confirmedValue and value

methods.name: _checkKeycode
methods.description: key press event handler

methods.name: open
methods.description: open the picker

methods.name: close
methods.description: close the picker

methods.name: toggle
methods.description: toggle the picker

methods.name: confirm
methods.description: confirms the input

methods.name: cancel
methods.description: cancels the input

The orientation against which to align the element horizontally

events.name: input-picker-closed
events.description:
input-picker-closed
Fired after a picker has been closed.

events.name: input-picker-opened
events.description:
input-picker-opened
Fired when a picker has been opened.

mixins.description: mixin to extend an picker with an `overlay-element`

properties.name: alwaysOnTop
properties.description: Set to true to keep overlay always on top.

properties.name: noOverlap
properties.description: Will position the element around the positionTarget without overlapping it.

properties.name: withBackdrop
properties.description:
Set to true to display a backdrop behind the overlay. It traps the focus
within the light DOM of the overlay.

properties.name: noCancelOnOutsideClick
properties.description: Set to true to disable canceling the overlay by clicking outside it.

properties.name: dynamicAlign
properties.description:
If true, it will use `horizontalAlign` and `verticalAlign` values as preferred alignment
and if there's not enough space, it will pick the values which minimize the cropping.

properties.name: autoFitOnAttach
properties.description: Set to true to auto-fit on attach.

properties.name: fitInto
properties.description: The element to fit the overlay into. By default it is the window.

properties.name: positionTarget
properties.description:
The element that should be used to position the overlay. If not set, it will
default to the polyfill node.

methods.name: fit
methods.description: Positions and fits the overlay into the `fitInto` element.

methods.name: notifyResize
methods.description: notify manually the overlay to resize

mixins.name: OverlayPickerMixin

attributes.name: always-on-top
attributes.description: Set to true to keep overlay always on top.

attributes.name: no-overlap
attributes.description: Will position the element around the positionTarget without overlapping it.

attributes.name: with-backdrop
attributes.description:
Set to true to display a backdrop behind the overlay. It traps the focus
within the light DOM of the overlay.

attributes.name: no-cancel-on-outside-click
attributes.description: Set to true to disable canceling the overlay by clicking outside it.

attributes.name: dynamic-align
attributes.description:
If true, it will use `horizontalAlign` and `verticalAlign` values as preferred alignment
and if there's not enough space, it will pick the values which minimize the cropping.

attributes.name: auto-fit-on-attach
attributes.description: Set to true to auto-fit on attach.

attributes.name: fit-into
attributes.description: The element to fit the overlay into. By default it is the window.

attributes.name: position-target
attributes.description:
The element that should be used to position the overlay. If not set, it will
default to the polyfill node.

mixins.description:
Mixin to extend an element for binding switch button to increment properties. Button-switches should be of class `switch` and have the attributes `prop` and `step` that define the property to increment in the given step.
The element is required to be extended with `Polymer.GestureEventListeners`.

properties.name: dwellTime
properties.description: dwell time of incrementing inputs by the buttons in milliseconds. It is minimal 15 milliseconds.

properties.name: dwellDelay
properties.description: delay when incrementing inputs by the buttons in milliseconds. It is minimal 15 milliseconds.

properties.name: _switchClassSelector
properties.description: class property of switches

methods.name: __increm
methods.description: increment property by being called by an Event on an `switch`-Node

params.name: once
params.description: if true, it doesn't setup an intervall to continue incrementing (e.g. keyPressEvents are fired itself repeatedly while the key is pressed)

mixins.name: SwitchMixin

attributes.name: dwell-time
attributes.description: dwell time of incrementing inputs by the buttons in milliseconds. It is minimal 15 milliseconds.

attributes.name: dwell-delay
attributes.description: delay when incrementing inputs by the buttons in milliseconds. It is minimal 15 milliseconds.
